alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 4:24PM MDT until August 05 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Larimer County in north central Colorado... * Until 630 PM MDT. * At 424 PM MDT, Emergency management reported flash flooding across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pennock Pass, Buckhorn Creek, Crystal Mountain. This includes the following additional locations... Box Prairie, Upper Buckhorn along County Road 44H and Crystal Mountain. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. THIS IS A LIFE THREATENING SITUATION! Heavy Rainfall will cause extensive and severe flooding of creeks, streams, roads and culverts in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across roads in the warning area.
